comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: 1961 picture of US Navy Vought F8U-2 Crusader 146933 VF-103 ‘Sluggers’ Modex 200. Vought F8U-2 Crusader 146906 VF-103 ‘Sluggers’ Modex 210. Tail code AJ of Carrier Air Group Eight (CVG-8) assigned to CVA-59 USS Forrestal. Same picture available to view on internet: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:F-8Cs_VF-103_CVG-8_CVA-59.jpg Two Vought F8U-2 Crusaders (BuNos 146906, 146933) VF-103 Sluggers. VF-103 was assigned flying the F8U-2(F-8C) to CVG-8 aboard USS Forrestal (CVA-59) from 1960 to 1963. ………………………………………………………………………………………………….. 1961 color profile of F8U-2 149633 with VF-103 as Modex 200 may be viewed on this internet webpage: (look for entry with following caption and click on picture to view) wp.scn.ru/en/forum/in_focus/812-3-103 F-8C (F8U-2) Unit: VF-103, US Navy Serial: 200/AJ (BuNo.146933) CVA-59 USS Forrestal, circa 1961. ………………………………………………………………………………………………….. Both built originally as F8U-2 Crusader, from September 1962 they were redesignated F-8C. ………………………………………………………………………………………………….. Originally built under contract as an F8U-2, from September 1962 Bu No 146933 became an F-8C. www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_5.html F-8C Crusader 146933 was one of 87 rebuilt as F-8K: www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_13.html F8U-2 /F-8C/F-8K info courtesy Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago Illinois It appears F8U-2 /F-8C/F-8K 146933 final years where with utility and training units. Two pictures of F-8C 146933 with composite unit VU-4/VC-4 may be viewed on pages 23 & 24 of this major commercially available PDF document which may be downloaded: www.scribd.com/doc/57767288/Vought-s-F-8-Crusader-Navy-Fi... (scroll down using slider bar on right to page 80 of this major PDF document to view) Page 23; VU-4 F-8C 146933 (side number 2) and 145588 over southeast Virginia on 13 April 1965, tails are red with a white circle and unit code letters JR. Page 24; VC-4 F-8C 146933 on 5-24-67 with a tow cable fuselage pylon, side number 16, red tail & white circle with unit code JR. Black fin tip with gold cross. On 3rd March 1972, F-8K 146933 crashed while with Marine Air Reserves Training Detachment (MARTD) based at NAS Atlanta, Georgia, 2 miles from Waltham Mississippi. Pilot US Marine Corps Major W.E.Conder ejected: This website record in chronological order has information about the loss: www.ejection-history.org.uk/Aircraft_by_Type/F_8_Crusader... Info on MARTD NAS Atlanta: www.cloudnet.com/~djohnson/usmc.htm VMF-351, Marine Air Reserve Detachment, NAS Atlanta, Georgia By 1970, VMF-351 was operating the upgraded F-8K (formerly F-8C and F8U-2). The unit carried three tail codes on their Crusaders, 7B, 5B, and finally MC. Marine Fighter Squadron 351 was redesignated VMFA-351 in 1975, and transitioned to the F-4B Phantom II. ………………………………………………………………………………………………….. 1962 color profile of F8U-2/F-8C 146906: (look for entry with following caption and click on picture to view) wp.scn.ru/en/forum/in_focus/812-3-71 F-8C Unit: VF-103, US Navy Serial: 210/AJ (BuNo.146906) CVA-59 USS Forrestal, circa 1962. F8U-2 149606 was a static exhibit at the Paris Salon (Paris Air Show) Le Bourget Airport, Paris, France. (Salon International de l'Aéronautique et de l'Espace, Paris-Le Bourget) During early June 1961. www.flickr.com/photos/12167448@N05/4248859924/ F8U-2 Crusader 146906 was probably flown from the aircraft carrier USS Forrestal to Le Bourget as an exhibit paid for by the Ling-Temco-Vought Corporation. There is a record that F8U-2 Crusader 146906 crashed on March 8 1962 while in service with VF-103. In chronological order these internet webpages record the loss of F8U-2/F-8C 146906: www.ejection-history.org.uk/Aircraft_by_Type/f8_crusader.htm www.ejection-history.org.uk/Aircraft_by_Type/F_8_Crusader... 8th March 1962 USN, Crusader F-8C, 146906, VF-103, in USA, The pilot, Commander A. E. Westmoreland ejected, using a British Martin-Baker ejection seat. The location and circumstances are as yet unknown.
